channel.title: Pakistan Super League, 2016/17 news from ESPN Cricinfo.com
channel.description: Visit Cricinfo.com for up-to-the-minute cricket news, breaking cricket news, live cricket commentary, ball-by-ball commentary, cricket video, cricket audio and features.

image.title: Pakistan Super League, 2016/17 news from ESPN Cricinfo.com

item.title: 'This is how big players are made' - Nawaz
item.description: Mohammad Nawaz was oozing confidence after defending six runs in the final over against Peshawar

item.title: Quetta Gladiators overseas players pull out of PSL final
item.description: The majority of Quetta Gladiator's overseas contingent have opted not to travel to Lahore for the PSL final

item.title: Nerveless Nawaz puts Quetta in PSL final
item.description: In a repeat of last year's knockout match, Quetta Gladiators beat Peshawar Zalmi by one run to make their second successive PSL final

item.title: DRS to be used in PSL play-off matches
item.description: The PSL has confirmed that the Decision Review System will be used for the tournament's three play-off matches starting from Tuesday

item.title: PSL production agency withdraws from final, new company brought in
item.description: Companies that handle the HawkEye technology and Spider-cam have also pulled out from the final, which will be televised without the supporting components

item.title: PSL aims to finalise foreign players list for Lahore
item.description: With the Punjab government giving a public go-ahead to the Pakistan Super League final taking place in Lahore, the tournament organisers have one last problem to solve

item.title: Karachi Kings qualify with clutch victory
item.description: Karachi Kings dominated the final league game to beat Islamabad United by six wickets, thereby qualifying for the playoffs of the Pakistan Super League

item.title: Lahore missed out on key moments - McCullum
item.description: Lahore Qalandars captain Brendon McCullum admitted that his team had run second in key moments during the tournament, leaving them on the brink of missing out on a playoff spot for the second successive season

item.title: Vintage Afridi knock puts Peshawar in first place
item.description: Shahid Afridi turned back the clock with a brisk 45 not out to take Peshawar Zalmi past Quetta Gladiators by two wickets and into first place on the PSL table

item.title: Pollard last-ball six keeps Karachi alive
item.description: With Karachi Kings needing 10 off the last two balls, Kieron Pollard tonked two sixes to keep their hopes of a playoff spot alive

item.title: Islamabad secure playoff spot after late Quetta stumble
item.description: With seven needed off two overs and seven wickets in hand, Quetta Gladiators managed to trip over the final hurdle to lose to Islamabad United by one run

item.title: Peshawar triumph after spectacular Lahore collapse
item.description: Lahore lost five wickets for one run to stumble in their chase of 167 and fell short by 17 runs in their PSL clash against Peshawar in Dubai

item.title: Clinical Quetta clinch playoff berth with victory
item.description: Quetta Gladiators dominated Karachi Kings to win by six wickets in what was arguably the most lopsided match of PSL 2017

item.title: County players seek security assurances ahead of PSL final
item.description: A number of county cricketers named in a list of players who could be called upon to travel to Pakistan for the final of the Pakistan Super League (PSL) remain unsure about whether they will go

item.title: Elliott six seals nerve-wracking one-wicket win for Lahore
item.description: Grant Elliott channeled his 2015 World Cup semi-final heroics for Lahore Qalanders, hitting a six in the final over off Mohammad Sami to seal a one-wicket win over Islamabad United at Sharjah

item.title: Shahid Afridi says international career is over
item.description: Shahid Afridi has said "goodbye to international cricket" following his 28-ball 54 for Peshawar Zalmi against Karachi Kings in the ongoing PSL

item.title: Mir repels Afridi heroics to secure win for Karachi
item.description: Usama Mir defended 18 off the final over, dismissing Shahid Afridi and Hasan Ali on consecutive balls to seal a nine-run win for Karachi Kings over Peshawar Zalmi

item.title: 'Chasing 200 a lot easier than chasing 120' - Pietersen
item.description: The English batsman also said that he was the low scores in the first round of the tournament minor blips given his successes in the recent Big Bash League

item.title: Bowlers, Smith haul Islamabad to last-ball win
item.description: Opening batsman Dwayne Smith anchored Islamabad United's chase with an unbeaten 72 to help secure a last-ball five-wicket win over Peshawar Zalmi at Sharjah

item.title: Pietersen's blitz blindsides Lahore
item.description: Quetta Gladiators smashed 63 runs off their last 17 balls - led by Kevin Pietersen at his world-beating best - to stun Lahore Qalandars by five wickets in Sharjah
